items.title: Cities vs. Rising Seas
items.abstract: Around the world, tens of millions could lose their homes in the coming decades. Planning is the key to protecting them.

items.title: Why New York’s (Mostly) Vegan Mayor Wants to Cut the City’s Meat Budget
items.abstract: The city estimates that its food purchases produce as much carbon as the exhaust from 70,000 gas-fueled cars.

items.title: Our City Could Become One of the World’s Greenest, but It Won’t Be Easy
items.abstract: Cutting greenhouse gas emissions from big buildings will help the economy and make New York a nicer place to live.

items.title: How New York City’s Trees and Shrubs Help Clear Its Air
items.abstract: As advocates are pushing the city to plant more trees, new research shows the role of urban greenery in absorbing carbon emissions.

items.title: A Key to Controlling Emissions: More Buildings in a City’s Unused Spaces
items.abstract: Constructing more condensed communities in existing neighborhoods has been found to go a long way toward fighting climate change.
